title: Teachings on Judgment and Discipleship
shortSummary: Matthew 7 presents Jesus' teachings on judgment, prayer, discernment, and obedience. It emphasizes the importance of humility, sincere faith, and living according to God's will as the foundation for entering the kingdom of heaven. The chapter concludes with a call to build one’s life on the solid rock of Christ’s words.
timeline: c. AD 30 - Jesus' Sermon on the Mount teachings during His earthly ministry

keyCharacters.name: Jesus Christ
keyCharacters.description: The Messiah and teacher delivering authoritative instructions on righteous living and the kingdom of heaven.

keyCharacters.name: False Prophets
keyCharacters.description: Individuals who appear righteous outwardly but inwardly are harmful, warning believers to discern true from false teachers.

keyCharacters.name: Disciples/Followers
keyCharacters.description: Those who hear Jesus’ teachings and are called to live by them, building their lives on His words.

definitions.definition: A small speck or splinter, used metaphorically for a minor fault or sin.
A large piece of wood, symbolizing a major fault or sin, highlighting hypocrisy when judging others.
A metaphor warning against giving valuable truths to those who will not appreciate or respect them.
A narrow and difficult entrance symbolizing the challenging path to eternal life.
The visible results or evidence of a person's character or teaching, used to discern true from false prophets.

outline.heading: Warnings Against Hypocritical Judgment
outline.description: Jesus instructs believers not to judge others hypocritically, emphasizing self-examination before correcting others to avoid condemnation.

outline.heading: Proper Discernment and Prayer
outline.description: Believers are cautioned to wisely share spiritual truths and encouraged to persist in prayer, trusting God’s goodness in answering requests.

outline.heading: The Golden Rule and the Two Ways
outline.description: Jesus summarizes the law with the Golden Rule and contrasts the broad path leading to destruction with the narrow path leading to life.

outline.heading: Beware of False Prophets
outline.description: Jesus warns about deceptive teachers who appear harmless but are dangerous, teaching that their true nature is revealed by their fruits.

outline.heading: True Discipleship and Judgment
outline.description: Not all who claim faith will enter the kingdom; only those who do the Father’s will are accepted, highlighting the necessity of genuine obedience.

outline.heading: The Wise and Foolish Builders
outline.description: Jesus concludes by comparing those who obey His words to a wise builder on rock, and those who do not to a foolish builder on sand, underscoring the importance of obedience.

application: Examine your own heart and motives before judging others to avoid hypocrisy and receive God’s mercy.
Persist in prayer with confidence that God, your loving Father, will provide what is truly good for you.
Practice the Golden Rule daily by treating others as you desire to be treated, fulfilling God’s law.
Test all teachings by their fruits and remain obedient to Christ’s words to build a secure spiritual foundation.

keyVerses.text: Judge not, that ye be not judged.
keyVerses.significance: This verse sets the tone for the chapter, warning against hypocritical judgment and encouraging humility.

keyVerses.text: Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:
keyVerses.significance: It assures believers of God’s readiness to respond to sincere prayer and persistent seeking.

keyVerses.text: Therefore all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them: for this is the law and the prophets.
keyVerses.significance: Known as the Golden Rule, this verse summarizes the ethical teaching of Scripture and guides Christian conduct.

keyVerses.text: Therefore whosoever heareth these sayings of mine, and doeth them, I will liken him unto a wise man, which built his house upon a rock:
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the necessity of obedience to Jesus’ teachings as the foundation for a stable and enduring life.
